titleStmt.title: James F. Robinson, Jr. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5973

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Lexington Ky
Nov 10th 1864
To His Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky
Dr Sir!

Jno B. Payne a relative of mine was indicted in the Franklin Court for dealing cards. Mr Payne is the son of a widowed mother and several sisters dependent upon him for a support, he is limited as to means, has settled with Mr Scott the Commonwealths Atty for his part. and I do hope that you will exercise your Executive clemency and remit. that part of his fine due the Commonwealth if not all a part that he may be enabled to pay the bal, his offense was slight compared with those daily committed by persons in our midst high in authority

Vary Resp
Yr obdt Servt
Jas. F. Robinson jr

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
Jno Payne
$500 each
Remitted
15th Nov/64
